text: Larisa B.C. (Greek: Λάρισα K.A.E.), or Larisa Basket (alternate spelling: Larissa), is a Greek professional basketball club that is located in Larissa, Greece.Ερμής Αγιάς: Γίνεται ΚΑΕ και περιμένει απάντηση για την wild card . It is a part of the G.S. Ermis Agias Larisa (Γ.Σ. Ερμής Αγιάς Λάρισα) multi- sports club. The club's full original name was Gymnastikos Syllogos Agias Ermis Larisa (Γυμναστικός Σύλλογος Επαρχίας Αγιάς Ερμής Λάρισα). The club's official emblem is a seal with Hermes (Ermis) on it, one of the Greek gods. The team's colors are white and blue. The team currently competes in the Greek Basket League, the top-tier level of Greek basketball. ==History== Larisa B.C. was originally founded as Ermis Agias Larisa B.C. (Ερμής Αγιάς Λάρισα K.A.E.), in 1984. With the club originally being located in Agia, Larissa (regional unit), Greece. The club won the Greek 4th Division's 3rd Group, during the 2015–16 season, and was thus promoted up to the Greek 3rd Division, for the 2016–17 season. The team was then promoted up to the Greek 2nd Division, for the 2017–18 season. Ermis Agias Larisa was given a wild card place in the top- tier level Greek Basket League's 2019–20 season.Basket League: Στον Ερμή Αγιάς η wild card . The club then relocated from Agia to Larissa (city), and was renamed to Larisa Basketball Club.Ερμής Αγιάς: Έγινε ΚΑΕ και μετονομάστηκε επίσημα σε Λάρισα . ==Arenas== Larisa B.C.'s main home arena is the Larissa Neapolis Indoor Arena, which is located in the city of Larissa. The arena has a seating capacity of 4,000 people in the permanent upper tier, and it can be expanded to a capacity of 5,500 people with optional retractable seating added to the lower tier.Larissa Neapolis Arena. The club previously played its home games at the small 300 seat Agias Municipal Indoor Sports Center, which is located in Agia. ==Honors and titles== ===Domestic competitions=== *Greek 4th Division 3rd Group Champion: (2015–16) ==Season by season== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%; text-align:center" !Season !Tier !Division ! ! !Greek Cup !colspan=3|European competitions |- |bgcolor=#efefef|2015–16 | 4 | align=left| C Basket League | bgcolor=gold | 1st | 20–2 | | colspan=3 | |- |bgcolor=#efefef|2016–17 | 3 | align=left| B Basket League | bgcolor=#CC9966 | 3rd | 22–8 | | colspan=3 | |- |bgcolor=#efefef|2017–18 | 2 | align=left| A2 Basket League | bgcolor= | 9th | 15–15 | | colspan=3 | |- |bgcolor=#efefef|2018–19 | 2 | align=left| A2 Basket League | bgcolor= | 7th | 17–13 | | colspan=3 | |} ==Roster== ===Depth chart=== ==Notable players== * Nestoras Kommatos * Dimitris Cheilaris * Ioannis Demertzis * Nikos Kalles * Dimitrios Lolas * Paris Maragkos * Vassilis Papadopoulos * Nondas Papantoniou * Tasos Spyropoulos * Vangelis Tzolos * Ioannis Vavatsikos * Rihards Kuksiks * Dovydas Redikas * Stefan Živanović * Johnny Berhanemeskel * Jehyve Floyd * Billy Garrett Jr. * Blake Hamilton * Darnell Harris * Anthony Hickey * Terell Parks * Scottie Reynolds * Brandon Rush * Elijah Thomas ==Head coaches== {| |- style="color:#FFFFFF; background:#342D7E;" ! width="50%" |Head Coach ! width="30%" |Years |- | Grigoris Giassaris || 2013–2018 |- bgcolor="#EFEFEF" | Stefanos Perkos || 2018 |- | Ioannis Livanos || 2018–2019 |- bgcolor="#EFEFEF" | Kostas Keramidas || 2019 |- | Vassilis Fragkias || 2019 |- bgcolor="#EFEFEF" | Vangelis Angelou || 2019–2020 |} ==References== ==External links== * Official Website * Larisa B.C.
